description: Several small birds are depicted comfortably resting inside the gaping mouths of large alligators. One bird, perched precariously between rows of sharp teeth, expresses discontent not with being eaten, but with the 'atmosphere' inside the predator's mouth. This presents a surreal inversion of the natural order, treating a life-threatening situation as a mere environmental discomfort, highlighting the absurdity of anthropomorphizing prey in such a peculiar, confined space.
caption: “Food’s okay ... I just can’t get used to the atmosphere.”
